alert.note: Alert for Greene; Perry; Stone; Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:06PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Perry, Wayne, northwestern Greene and Stone Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1106 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Goodwater to 8 miles west of Perkinston. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Waynesboro, Wiggins, Richton, Clara, Perkinston, McHenry, Beaumont and New Augusta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southeastern Mississippi.
